CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The photovoltaic properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) were preliminarily investigated , and high shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) |

The other term "high shortcircuit current (14.87 mA / cm^2) and PCE (2.71%)" is not a material name, but rather a property of the material PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The photovoltaic properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) were preliminarily investigated , and high shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| photovoltaic properties |
| shortcircuit current |
| PCE |

The paragraph mentions three property names: "photovoltaic properties," "shortcircuit current," and "PCE" (which stands for power conversion efficiency). These are the entities that should be included in the table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| photovoltaic properties |
| shortcircuit current |
| PCE |

After reviewing the paragraph again, I still find the same three entities that can be considered as material properties: "photovoltaic properties," "shortcircuit current," and "PCE" (which stands for power conversion efficiency). These are the entities that should be included in the table.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The photovoltaic properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) were preliminarily investigated , and high shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 14.87 mA / cm^2 |
| 2.71% |

The two "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are "14.87 mA / cm^2" and "2.71%". These entities represent the measured values of the short-circuit current and power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the photovoltaic material PDTP - DTDPP(Bu), respectively.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 14.87 mA / cm^2 |
| 2.71% |

After re-evaluating the paragraph, I confirm that the two entities "14.87 mA / cm^2" and "2.71%" are the only clear references to the values of material properties. These entities represent the measured values of the short-circuit current and power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the photovoltaic material PDTP - DTDPP(Bu), respectively.
